    Fixation detection by dispersion method

    fix_dispersion.Rd

    Detects fixations according to a method similar to that proposed by Salvucci & Goldberg (1996). Evaluates the absolute range of values of both x and y coordinates. Looks for sufficient periods in which the ranges are both below the specified dispersion tolerance. NAs are considered breaks in the data and are not permitted within a valid fixation period.

    Usage

    fix_dispersion(
  data,
  min_dur = 150,
  disp_tol = 100,
  run_interp = TRUE,
  NA_tol = 0.25,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    A dataframe with raw data (time, x, y, trial) for one participant (the standardised raw data form for eyeproc)

    min_dur

    Minimum duration (in milliseconds) of period over which fixations are assessed

    disp_tol

    Maximum tolerance (in pixels) for the dispersion of values allowed over fixation period

    run_interp

    include a call to eyetools::interpolation on each trial

    NA_tol

    the proportion of NAs tolerated within any window of samples that is evaluated as a fixation

    Value

    Examples
